intro: Sinomalus kansuensis, commonly known as the Kansu sinomalus, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
